alert.note: Alert for Clay; Kanawha; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 6:01PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Kanawha, southwestern Roane and west central Clay Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 600 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sissonville, or 10 miles north of Charleston, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Charleston, South Charleston, Sissonville, Clendenin, Pinch, Coal Fork and Elkview. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 23. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 117. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 56 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 93 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 77 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. If outdoors, seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause ponding of water in urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses, as well as other poor drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground.
